newsitem.title: GERMANY: German church is set on fire.
newsitem.headline: German church is set on fire.

text.p: An evangelical church in the northern German city of Hamburg was set on fire on Wednesday after being daubed with right-wing and Satanic symbols, police said.
No one was injured and the building was only slightly damaged by the fire, which was set at the building's entrance door in the early hours.
Police said the symbols daubed on the church walls did not necessarily mean that right-wing extremists started the blaze since they said did not usually use Satanic symbols.

A police spokeswoman said that, unlike a church gutted by suspected right-wing extremists just over a week ago, the parish involved had not protected asylum seekers or taken part in political activity.

Suspected extremists set fire to a church in the northern town of Luebeck 10 days ago. They daubed Nazi swastikas on the walls and scrawled the name of a local priest whose parish is sheltering a family of asylum seekers to prevent their deportation to Algeria.
